Topic.Title: Prediction

Message.Msg: I was comparing the sentiment of AAPL and AMZN. AAPL comes out with a product that moves into the size range of the Kindle Fire and it falls and AMZN (which makes no / very little money on KF) goes up. AAPL kept falling and people turned against it. AMZN will have the same one day but harder since it has no fundamentals to back it up and never will. Never. Somehow AMZN gets away with not sharing numbers and not making profits. How many decades can you go "sacrificing profits for market share"?

Topic.Title: let's see if next week we get a huge breakout above 264.11 and putting to validity to what I pointed out: a giant inverse H&S

Message.Msg: How do you know I've lost $$$. In truth, I've lost some $$$ but hope to make asymmetrical returns when AMZN tanks. Every time I hear someone take about making money being long AMZN I think of the housing market in 2006 - 2007. I had friends that bought way above their means. Before the crash, they encouraged me to do the same. According to them, this was easy money as the housing market was going up 10% to 20%. Well I never did buy over my means and I still have my home. I know a lot of people who don't. Just because you've made money in the past doesn't mean you're going to make money in the future off of AMZN. Ask yourself why you're long. If its based on fundamentals, stay long. If its based on the stock price rising in the past, you're going to get burned. Time will tell.

Topic.Title: Sell call???

Message.Msg: I you're naked , then you've got the cash to short it... it would gives you $272 and $280 short price, that wouldn't be bad.... as long as it doesn't take to much % of ur portfolio and you could increase your short position higher that isn't a bad position.... Usually I rather write call spread..... In best manipulation case I see about $295...(calculated on rev h&s.) so you have to be able to increase your short position if it goes higher..... Finally, for sure it wouldn't be a bad thing to go short at those levels.... the on neg thing is you're choosing strike that are close to the neck line..... amzn will swing $25 on way or the other days following the er..... I'm working my amzn short position and will do it for probably another 18 months or more... I did the same thing with many stocks in the past... I don't care if it takes some years as I writing of lot of derivatives all the way.......

Topic.Title: let's see if next week we get a huge breakout above 264.11 and putting to validity to what I pointed out: a giant inverse H&S

Message.Msg: Ok, I'll explain and give . Here's my trading history for AMZN: B @ 136 11/2010 B @ 176 12/2011 B @ 176 2/2012 S @ 184 3/2012 S @ 227 4/2012 S @ 260 9/2012 B @ 228 10/2012 As of now, the average cost per share for what I now own is $43 / share. So, if AMZN goes below $43, I'll be in the red. Now, I'm not bragging. I should have done MUCH better than I have. I've never traded so actively before, and I'm still learning. But if a dumb hillbilly like me can make money trading AMZN, anyone can. During the time I've made over $200 per share, you've lost money. I'm not much of a believer in charts, who knows how accurate the numbers are. I invest in AMZN based on my judgement of JB's ablity.

Message.Msg: You could buy a lottery ticket instead. AMZN doesn't act like you'd expect. They could have terrible earnings, and give some reason everything is rosey, and the stock will spike 10%. I'm just a dumb hillbilly, but unlike the brilliant shorts here, I make money.

Message.Title: N6000baby,kid, NO it isn't a hudge rev h&s, if you want to see large ones
Message.Msg: go back to look amzn ... 1. 2001-2002 : 2 years pattern... 2. 2008-2009 : almost 2 years pattern A smaller one in 2006 : 14 months pattern. Then this one would be 4 months.... a baby rev h&s for amzn... If ever you've got this breakout, my bet is a STRAIT H&S would be created....sept oct would become the left shoulder.... Thar being said, a false breakout / double topis also possible.....

Topic.Title: Sell call???

Message.Msg: Maybe it could go to $270... I'll keep a close eye on AMZN over the next two weeks. I'm skeptical that it'll rise above 264 (it's all time high) as I don't see any drivers. Volume has be low the last few weeks. We've had reports of disappointing retail holiday sales. AMZN has had two disappointing quarterly reports in a row (the one coming up could be the third), it has an absurdly high pe, etc. What would drive it higher from here? Maybe a broad based market rally??? Don't see the market going up after the last week's 4% run up (which was a fiscal cliff resolution run up). Who is going to buy AMZN at these levels? What's the catalyst?

Topic.Title: Sell call???

Message.Msg: Agree that the er will be a huge catalyst for a price move (I think a lower move). No way I'd want to be a naked call write going into a report though. Too much risk. My calls expire the 18th. To my knowledge, AMZN reports the 31st. Correct?

Topic.Title: Sell call???

Message.Msg: Naked calls on er ? well it depends how someone play amzn... if someone want to be short 200 shares , a good way to do it is to write 2 itm calls, he we'll get a better price than acual pps.... if he think that $265 and $270 are really good price to sell short amzn, he will even get better price with the cashed premium.... however if the stock price drops on er, he a limited profit.... I'm short amzn since more than a year, I'm writing so many options that I'm easily in the green.... I still write calls(weekies) to increase my short position(or get the premium) and still writing some puts but only few ones.... I will ride the long coming downtrend.... all the way to $100... and I'm very not in a hurry.... For er release, yahoo is saying jan 31th, nasdaq feb 5th..... I'll be sure tomorrow morning (or later tonight) when I'll open my trading account....

Topic.Title: Sell call???

Message.Msg: "if someone want to be short 200 shares , a good way to do it is to write 2 itm calls, he we'll get a better price than acual pps...." Anybody that practiced this strategy in the last 4 yearz got consistantly obliterated in the short trade, and got put to the cheap premium call that they had to make good on... A double whammy to a quick death - murdered by robots. Chancez are their short trade came closer to normal the monday after the friday they were called to make good on their optionz. Face it folks. Optionz are a dumb ars way to bet, independant of the fancy 'dragon fly', 'butter fly', or what ever other crack induced combo name you want to trade against... The blood of the retail optionz trader haz more then made up for the significantly reduced volumez with which underlying stoks are traded over the yearz. One day they will figure it out, but not before they are broke.

Topic.Title: Analysts, please explain to me...

Message.Msg: The big boys are playing the MOMO junkies and it will become clear soon enough. Price is not truth... just a short to medium term measure of mass psychology and herd mentality. I encourage all of you smack talking longs to add significantly here, say 20-25%. The trapped institutions would very much appreciate it... My analysis is not faulty. The analog business is an accounting scam (not fraud, just poor understanding of the cost drivers and economic potential). Amazon's model was well suited to the past, not the future. TGT, WMT, and COST are all better positioned.

Topic.Title: Analysts, please explain to me...

Message.Msg: To be clear, Amazon will continue to grow revenues, but only because it it willing to lose money in the process. It will become clear this year that Amazon's profitability issue is not the result of very high levels of investment, but rather some fundamental business model flaws that derive from the cost drivers. Amazon knows this. It's why it dropped monthly Prime and why it began financing 3P vendors... I'm just waiting for the day somebody like Gov. Rick Snyder says either you collect tax in our state, or we (via all state and local pension funds) divest any Amazon related assets. All it takes is one smart Governor (and Rick is very smart) and a tsunami will follow. State revenues go up, local purchases go up, velocity of money in the local economy goes up (further reinforcing the positive impact on state sales tax). Only Amazon loses. Pretty solid move for all other parties...
